question.name: Downloading software to the LEGO kit
Goal of the game
question.answer: The goal of Pacman is to eat all the points on the playing field, whilst not getting caught by the ghosts. The game ends when all points have been eaten or you have.

question.name: Starting a game
question.answer:
To start a new game either choose "New Game" or "Continue" on the title screen. If you choose "New Game" you will be prompted to select a level file to play. If you choose continue the last played, or default level will be used.
Whether you choose one or the other you'll be prompted to turn on all three robots and place them facing upwards as shown on the game screen. Once this is done the game will begin.

question.name: Playing the game
question.answer:
The game controls are simple. You can move in four directions up, down, left or right. The default key configuration is mapped to the directional keys. These keys can be also be assigned connected joypads or W,A,S and D. While playing you can pause at any time by pressing space.
Once a game has been lost or won the you will be prompted to type in your name, so that it might be added to the high score list of the current level. After prompting for your name you will be asked to save the replay of your game. As with the high score this is optional.
If saved the replay may be viewed anytime by choosing the "View Replay" option from the title screen.

question.name: Online and offline play
question.answer: The game has two modes online and offline. When playing offline you only play on one computer. When playing online you use three LEGO robots to emulate the different entities' movement on the field.

question.name: Loading a level
question.answer: To load a level choose the "New Game" option on the title screen, you'll then be prompted to select the level which you wish to load. Once selected the game will start

question.name: Changing input device
question.answer:
The input device, or key configuration can be changed on the options screen by scrolling down to the selected entity and then by pressing right or left. If any USB devices are connected they can be selected here also.
Should you wish to play against a friend you can assign keys to ghosts as well.

question.name: Changing skin
question.answer:
The skin used on the game screen can be changed on the options screen by scrolling down to the "Skin" option and cycling through the available options using the left and right keys.
Skins shouls be placed in a seperate sub directory in the skin directory. Skins must have all the needed tiles to be accepted by the program. Tilesize is determined by the base.png tile.

question.name: Title screen
question.answer:
To navigate the title screen press up or down, and enter to select an option.
New Game
Start a new game by choosing and loading a new level.
Continue Game
Start a new game using the currently loaded or default level.
View Replay
A replay is the entire collection of movements recorded during a game session. As with a normal game, a replay can be played both online and offline. An online replay should only be played when the appropriate physical field is available.
View High Scores
This option let's you view the high scores assigned to the currently loaded level. The high scores are recorded for the ten best players.
Options
This option let's you view the options screen.
Quit
If you choose quit the credits will be shown, once done the program will terminate. Should you wish to quit imediately press ESC.

question.name: Game screen
question.answer: The game screen shows the level, with entities, in the middle of the screen and points obtained so far in the top right corner. If you wish to pause the execution of the game press space. Whilst the game is paused you can press Y to quit to the title screen.

question.name: Option screen
question.answer:
The options on the option screen are traversed similarly to the title screen by up and down keys. Options are changed by pressing left or right key. On the buttom of the screen a description of the selected option is printed.
There is no way to reset to default options, other than restarting the program. Options are always reset on restart.
Pacman - Key config
The keys assigned to Pacman is left, right, up and down by default. The key can be changed by using the arrowkeys.
Ghost 1 - Difficulty / Key config
Change the difficulty or assign keys to the first ghost. Difficulties are described below.
Ghost 2 - Difficulty / Key config
Change the difficulty or assign keys to the first ghost. Difficulties are described below.
Skin
Change the skin used to display the game with.
Volume
Change the volume level of the game from 0 - 10 (off - high).
Interface
Specify via what interface the tower used to communicate with the LEGO robots is connected. Usually USB.
Difficulty settings
There are three difficulty settings ranging from easy to hard.
Easy
An easy ghost just wanders around randomly, as though it was blind.
Normal
The normal ghost will give chase if you're in sight, sometimes it will change it's mind but will soon follow you again. If the ghost looses sight of you it will continue in it's current direction if it can.
Hard
This ghost is unbeatable, it will find you if there is way.

question.name: About Level Editor
question.answer: Level Editor is an application with which you can create or scan your own levels and the use them in your Pacman game. Levels can be created using mouse or scanned using a LEGO robot.

question.name: Handcreating a level
question.answer:
To create a level that is playable, you need to select the path brush button on the toolbar or go to the brush menu and select it there. Once selected left-click or drag the mouse over the tiles you wish to add nodes to. If you've somehow placed a node you wish to delete right-click it. If you wish to add nodes with a special points value, change the number in the points textbox, and draw over the nodes you wish to change value for or the tiles you wish to add new nodes to.
Once you've done drawing nodes select the Pacman or ghost brush to add these. You can only add one Pacman and two ghosts. Ghosts and Pacman can be removed by right-clicking them. Once you've done placing entities save the level and your done.

question.name: Scanning a level
question.answer: To scan a level choose "Scan New Level" from the "File" menu and press scan.

question.name: Toolbar
question.answer:
The toolbar is placed below the menu bar and holds buttons for commonly used functions.
Path brush
The path brush is used to draw the nodes that the entities of the game traverse. When left-clicking on an empty tile a new node will be added with the amount of points specified in the points textbox. When placing a new node, links will be established to any nodes adjacent to it. It is not possible to remove or add connections seperately. When left-clicking on an already existing node the points held by the node will be changed to reflect the number of points specified in the points textbox. When right-clicking on a node it will be removed and all connections and links to it severed. The path brush can also be selected be pressing "CTRL + 1" or going to "Brush > Use Path Brush". The path brush is the default brush.
Pacman brush
The Pacman brush is used to place Pacman's starting position on the playing field. You can only place one Pacman. To remove any enitity on the playing field right-click it. To add pacman left click on a none occupied node. The ghost brush can also be selected be pressing "CTRL + 2" or going to "Brush > Use Pacman Brush".
Ghost brush
The ghost brush is used to place ghost starting positions on the playing field. You can at maximum place two ghosts. To remove any enitity on the playing field right-click it. To add place a ghost left click on a none occupied node. The Pacman brush can also be selected be pressing "CTRL + 3" or going to "Brush > Use Ghost Brush".
Show / hide grid
When clicked a grid will be layed over the canvas, so that each node can be distinguished. When clicked again the grid will be hidden. The grid can also be shown by pressing "CTRL + G" or going to "View > Show Grid".
Show / hide points
When clicked the points associated with every node will be shown on the canvas. When clicked again points will be hidden. Points can also be shown by pressing "CTRL + P" or going to "View > Show Points".
Points textbox
The number in the points box denotes how many points will be associated with each new node drawn or old node edited. The number of points a node holds can be checked by moving the mouse over it, whilst checking the points label on the status bar.

ul.li:
New level - CTRL + N
Clears canvas and let's you start creating a new level. If the current level you're working on have not been saved, you'll be asked if you'd like to save it before creating a new one.

Scan New level - CTRL + SHIFT + O
Scan new level opens the scan level dialog and let's you scan a physical level using a robot. If the current level you're working on have not been saved, you'll be asked if you'd like to save it before creating a new one.

Open... - CTRL + O
Let's you open a previously saved level. Any highscores associated with the level will be removed once it has been changed! If the current level you're working on have not been saved, you'll be asked if you'd like to save it before creating a new one.

Save - CTRL + S
Let's you save the level you're currently working on. If you have previously saved the level it will be saved to the file you last saved it to. If you havn't previously saved your level your will be asked to choose a file to save to. When changing a level all highscore data will be removed.

Save As... - CTRL + ALT + S
Let's you choose a file to save the level you're currently working on to. When changing a level all highscore data will be removed.

Quit
Shuts down the program. You are currently not prompted to save before quitting.

When left-clicking on an empty tile a new node will be added with the amount of points specified in the points textbox. When placing a new node, links will be established to any nodes adjacent to it. It is not possible to remove or add connections seperately. When left-clicking on an already existing node the points held by the node will be changed to reflect the number of points specified in the points textbox. When right-clicking on a node it will be removed and all connections and links to it severed.

Pacman brush - CTRL + 2
The Pacman brush is used to place Pacman's starting position on the playing field. You can only place one Pacman. To remove any enitity on the playing field right-click it. To add pacman left click on a none occupied node.

Ghost brush - CTRL + 3
The ghost brush is used to place ghost starting positions on the playing field. You can at maximum place two ghosts. To remove any enitity on the playing field right-click it. To add place a ghost left click on a none occupied node.

Show Grid - CTRL + G
When clicked a grid will be layed over the canvas, so that each node can be distinguished. When clicked again the grid will be hidden.

Show Points - CTRL + P
When clicked the points associated with every node will be shown on the canvas. When clicked again points will be hidden.

Nodes - ALT + 1
Changes the skin used to present the level on the canvas to the deafult skin. Nodes tries to look like what a physical level whould look like.

Pacman - ALT + 2
Changes the skin used to present the level on the canvas to the Pacman skin. Tha Pacman skin tries to emulate the look of the an old school pacman game. This is the skin used ingame.

Open Skin - ALT + 3
Let's you select a directory containing a skin you wish to view level with.

Open Skin - F1
Opens this help file.

question.name: Scan dialog
question.answer:
The scan is used to initiate the scanning of a physical level using a LEGO robot. The window consists of a log, scan and a cancel button. While scanning the already scanned parts of the level will be shown on the canvas.
Scan button
The scan button will start the scanning of a physical level. Before you press the scan button you should make sure that you've turned on the LEGO robot marked 1, downloaded the robot software, placed the LEGO robot on the physical level, and started the software.
Cancel button
The cancel button will stop the scanning process. Once you've stopped scanning in a level you cannot continue scanning the current level, if you try anyways the scanning process will start over.
Log The log is large text area in the middle of the scan dialog. Messages and status will be shown here.
